name: CreateCustomerPayment
description:
Create a new customer payment in Zoho Books.

Use this tool to record a new payment for a customer in Zoho Books. It should be called when you need to add a payment entry for accounting purposes or to update a customer's payment status.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization in Zoho Books. This is necessary to associate the payment with the correct organization.

parameters.name: payment_data
parameters.description: A JSON object containing payment details, including customer ID, payment mode, amount, date, and any associated invoices. Includes optional fields like reference number, description, exchange rate, and custom fields.

customer_id.description: Customer ID of the customer involved in the payment.

payment_mode.description: Mode through which payment is made. This can be check, cash, creditcard, banktransfer, bankremittance, autotransaction or others. Max-length [100]

amount.description: Amount paid in the respective payment.

date.description: Date on which payment is made. Format [yyyy-mm-dd]

reference_number.description: Reference number generated for the payment. A string of your choice can also be used as the reference number. Max-length [100]

invoice_id.description: Invoice ID of the required invoice.

invoices.description: List of invoices associated with the payment. Each invoice object contains invoice_id, invoice_number, date, invoice_amount, amount_applied and balance_amount.

exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate for the currency used in the invoices and customer's currency. The payment amount would be the multiplicative product of the original amount and the exchange rate.

invoice_id.description: Invoice ID of the required invoice.

account_id.description: ID of the cash/bank account the payment has to be deposited.

contact_persons.description: IDs of the contact personsthe thank you mail has to be triggered.

retainerinvoice_id.description: ID of the retainer invoice associated with the payment
